source: Stop Corruption; Ukrayinska Pravda; Novoye Vremya Ukraine
notes: On 27 June, a group of about 30 people encircled Stop Corruption journalists and rammed their car into the journalists' car in Odessa where the crew was investigating the activity of a judge. The car was damaged, no injuries were reported. [size=about 30]

On 24 June, people blocked several roads in Odessa, letting only passengers cars through and demanding that trucks weighing more than 10 tons do not use these roads as it leads to their destruction. Some truck drivers scuffled with the protesters. [size=no report]
On 28 May, unidentified individuals set fire to a branch office of the largest Russian private bank in Lviv. The building was partially damaged but no one was injured.

actor2: Military Forces of Ukraine (2014-) National Guard
assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ukraine (2014-) Prison Guards; Civilians (Ukraine)
source: Dumskaya; One Plus One; Liveuamap; AP; Bykvu; AFP; Novyny; RFE/RL
notes: On 27 May, between 100 and 500 prisoners rioted in an Odessa penal colony because of bad living conditions, searches in cells and mass beatings. The rioters set fire to a guard room and a car and barricaded themselves after taking three guards and three medical workers hostage. Several hundred National Guard officers were deployed to suppress the riot, about 15 prison employees and law enforcers were injured. [size=100-500]

On 21 May, supporters of Dimitris Koufodinas damaged two bank ATMs in the northern suburb of Aghia Paraskevi and in Kypseli in what is being treated as part of a string of violent incidents sparked by the rejection of the jailed November 17 hitman's furlough request and his decision to go on hunger strike. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: ND: New Democracy; Police Forces of Greece (2015-)
notes: On 20 May, ahead of the Supreme Court convening the following day regarding the furlough of hunger-striking Dimitris Koufodinas, his supporters targeted campaign offices of opposition party New Democracy in Alimos and in Nea Ionia in Athens breaking windows and setting them on fire with homemade explosive devices; they also smashed ATMs and later in the day set off from three university campuses to move dumpsters on Patission street in central Athens to set them on fire. The most serious incident occurred at the Athens University of Economics and Business involving 20 hooded individuals. Police detained 20 people that were released later except for two migrants that were arrested for not having the necessary permits to be in the country. No injuries were reported. [size=at least 20]

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On 18 May, in the early hours, hooded assailants launched consecutive attacks with Molotov cocktails in various areas in Attica where MAT riot police units were stationed. Initially, there were two attacks in Exarchia setting a car ablaze, followed by attacks in another 11 areas setting fires in garbage collection bins and setting one more car ablaze. According to police reports, there were no injuries and no detentions or arrests. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: SYRIZA: Coalition of the Radical Left
notes: On 13 May, supporters of Dimitris Koufodinas targeted the central offices of SYRIZA and another five SYRIZA offices in western Athens causing material damage and splashing paint. On the same day, they rallied in front of the Acropolis museum and unfurled a banner demonstrating against the rejection of a seventh furlough for the jailed hitman of the now defunct group November 17, who is on hunger strike. [size=no report]

On 10 May, unidentified assailants vandalised the campaign offices in various Attica locations [unspecified, coded to Athens] of the "New Beginning in Attica" candidate mayor for Athens. [size=no report]
On 7 May, unidentified individuals poured a bucket of raw sewage on a local journalist in Odessa after she wrote critically about construction on the territory of an open-air theatre.

assoc_actor_2: BPP-S: Petro Poroshenko Bloc-Solidarity; Police Forces of Ukraine (2014-)
notes: On 19 April, a group of deputies of the Petro Poroshenko Bloc supported a demonstration of activists against the use of an open-air theatre for concerts in Odessa. Another group of people poured a bucket of raw sewage on the deputies. Two people were arrested. [size=no report]

assoc_actor_2: Military Forces of Ukraine (2014-) National Guard
source: 5 Kanal; Liveuamap; Ministry of Internal Affairs of Ukraine
notes: On 30 March, after a car hit three National Guard soldiers in Odessa, killing one of them and severely wounding the other two, an unidentified man approached the victims and started beating them [fatality not coded being a result of a road accident].

assoc_actor_1: BCD: Belarusian Christian Democracy; MF: Young Front
notes: On 24 March, a commemoration rally of about 2000 people [size=2000] took place in Minsk's Kyiv Square to celebrate the 101st anniversary of the Belarusian People's Republic. Zmitser Dashkevich of the Young Front was arrested after an anti-governmental speech, while a political activist Natalya Basalyga and a BCD member Vitaly Rymashevsky were arrested during the rally.

On 20 March, police in Athens beat and insulted an asylum-seeker from Guinea who was trying to receive the 90 euros allocated to refugees by UNHCR. The police officers arrested him using excessive force, holding him down on the pavement and kicking his leg on a pre-existing injury from torture and punching him on the face and back. When he requested to go to hospital they said "Die here, not in hospital" and "Black go back to your country".

On 26 February, activists held a demonstration [size= no report] near a seaport in Odessa demanding an effective investigation into the murder of Kateryna Hanzyuk. Two of the activists were arrested and soon released.

On February 14, 2019, Sharofiddin Gadoyev, a Tajik opposition politician and deputy leader of the National Alliance of Tajikistan, was reportedly abducted in Moscow while meeting with Russian security officials and transported to Tajikistan against his will. Tajik authorities released a statement that Gadoyev returned to Tajikistan of his own free will, but on February 20 NAT released a pre-recorded statement of Gadoyev stating that he had no intentions of returning to Tajikistan and that the video is a precaution to be released on an event of his death or disappearance.

source: Meduza; Interfax; Kommersant; Avtonom.ru; RFE/RL; OVD Info
notes: On Friday, February 1, 2019, Moscow police detained at least 6 individuals thought to be members of various anarchist groups, including People's Defence (Narodnaya Oborona). Some of the detained are allegedly suspected of planting a fake bomb in Balashiha. 5 of the detainees were later released, but the remaining one, Azat Miftahov, a student at MGU, was being held without access to a lawyer and was being tortured in detention. The released detainees also reported being tortured.

source: Ukraine General Newswire; Interfax; Dumskaya; Liveuamap; Ukrayinska Pravda; OSCE SMM-Ukraine
notes: On Jan. 15 2019, up to 30 people gathered outside of the Consulate General of the Russian Federation in Odessa, Ukraine, to express support of Ukrainian Navy servicemen detained by Russia. Two people were arrested after the protesters began to splash red paint near the building.

assoc_actor_2: KPRF: Communist Party of the Russian Federation
notes: On Wednesday, January 9, 2019, unknown assailants assaulted Kirill Chirkin, a municipal deputy of the Lomonosov district from KPRF. Chirkin didn't report any major injuries as a result of the attack.

On Dec. 25 2018, local residents, AutoMaidan activists and members of National Corps gathered near a World War II memorial in Odessa, Ukraine, and dismantled a construction fence there claiming it was erected illegally. Three people were detained, including the leader of the Odessa AutoMaidan Vitalii Ustymenko.

On Monday, December 3, an unknown assailant attacked and stabbed Oleg Melnikov - the founder of Alternativa, a movement against modern slavery near his residence in the Moscow region. Melnikov was stabbed 3 times but didn't sustain major injuries and left the hospital that same day.

On Nov. 29, 2018: Around 100 students, after demonstrating against the name deal between Greece and Macedonia, threw stones at police, who fired tear gas to disperse them. Four rioters, all minors, were arrested for public disturbance.

On Nov. 29 2018, after the arrest of the Ukrainian blogger Oleksandr Baraboshko in Kiev, Ukraine, members of the military prosecutor's office inflicted light bodily injuries on him and tried to obtain evidence by force.

On Nov. 26 2018, about 100 protesters gathered in front of the building of the Consulate-General of the Russian Federation, some of whom threw fire crackers at the building in Odessa. They protested against Russian aggression on Ukrainian navy vessels in Kerch Strait.

source: Sputnik News Service; Interfax; ITAR-TASS; Liveuamap; AP; OSCE SMM-Ukraine; RFE/RL; Deutsche Welle
notes: On Nov. 25-26 2018, about 300 rioters gathered in front of the Russian Embassy in Kiev protesting against Russian aggression on Ukrainian navy vessels in Kerch Strait. Rioters deployed smoke bombs at the Embassy, fired flares and lit a diplomatic vehicle on fire.

actor2: Police Forces of Ukraine (2014-) Security Service of Ukraine
notes: On Nov. 21 2018, several people were detained in Kiev's Independence Square overnight as they protested against the planned opening of a KFC restaurant in the building that hosted the Euromaidan HQ and burnt out when riot police stormed it in 2014. The protesters insisted that the location for the restaurant was "inappropriate". Police arrived and started detaining people for hooliganism. Law enforcers used tear gas and batons when the protesters resisted.

source: ITAR-TASS; Liveuamap; AFP; Human Rights Information Centre; RFE/RL
notes: On Nov. 18 2018, about 40 representatives of LGBT rights activists were forced to cancel a demonstration in Shevchenko Park in Kyiv after far-fight counterdemonstrators assaulted several protesters and attacked a Canadian journalist trying to cover the event. Two women attacked with pepper spray were given first aid at the scene.
On 08 November 2018, an unidentified individual sprayed gas at the face of volunteers participating in the organisation of a conference about LGBT+ families and unions in Moscow.

On Nov. 6, 2018: Unknown individuals vandalized a bank branch as a demonstration at the death of Zak Kostopoulos, an LGBTQ activist who died in October after being attacked by a jewellery store owner and another man in downtown Athens. The assailants spray-painted slogans about Kostopoulos, shattered the windows and destroyed an ATM.

source: Meduza; TV Rain; AP; AFP; RFE/RL; Novaya Gazeta; OVD Info
notes: On Sunday, October 28 around 200 protesters took part in an unauthorized rally in Moscow opposing the arrests of the activists arrested in the "Novoe Velichiye" and "Set'" cases for allegedly belonging to an extremist group. Between 18 and 50 protesters were detained by local police. Some SERB members were reportedly involved.

On 28 October, an unauthorized rally 'For our and your children' [size=no report] was held in front of the Federal Security Service building in Moscow, organized by the parents and supporters of the defendants in the criminal cases "Novogo Velichiya" and "Seti". 14 people were detained as they marched in the center of Moscow. No clashes were reported.
On Saturday, October 13th Moscow police detained two at a silent protest organized by the Timeless Protest movement opposing the proposed pensions reform.

On 07 October 2018, 3 members of the youth movement "Vesna" were detained and questioned by Moscow police during an authorized protest action timed to coincide with Vladimir Putin's birthday on the same day.
On 01 October 2018, two police officers off duty shot a passer-by in Moscow after the later made a comment on the behaviour of the police officers who were shooting in the air.
On 24 September 2018 in Lviv, 20-far right vigilantes armed with bats and knifes attacked a group of 4 anarchists from Black Flag organisation. 4 were injured and hospitalized.
On 23 September, 2018, seven members of Other Russia were detained during a demonstration against the oil-chemical plant. The demonstrators put some fireworks and threw smoke grenades at the plant.

On 23 September, 2018, in total four participants of Bessrochny Protest were detained in Moscow. Bessrochny Protest is held in many cities across Russia following anti-pension reform protests of September 9. The protesters rally against the pension reforms and Government in general.
On 22 September, 2018, several protesters of Bessrochny Protest were detained in Moscow. Bessrochny Protest is taking place across many cities in Moscow, following the anti-pension reform protests.

source: Insider; UA:Pershiy; Liveuamap; Human Rights Information Centre
notes: On 22 September 2018 at 21:30, in Odessa, an unidentified armed man shot prominent activist Oleg Mykhailik. Oleg heads local branch of People's Will Party.

On Sept. 18, 2018: Anti-fascist groups organized a demonstration in Athens to mark the five-year anniversary of the killing of musician Pavlos Fyssas by a far-right party Golden Dawn supporter. Demonstrators marched from the site where the killing took place to Golden Dawn's offices. Minor scuffles occurred when hooded demonstrators threw rocks at riot policemen who responded by using tear gas.

On Sept. 17, 2018: An anarchist group of about 10 people attacked the Iranian embassy in Athens, smashing windows and throwing red paint in the courtyard demonstrating against Tehran's treatment of its Kurdish population. The attack was later claimed by Rouvikonas. The police officer on guard duty at the time of the attack was put under investigation for his handling of the incident, as video footage revealed he did not protect the embassy and was not dressed in his uniform.

On Sept. 17, 2018: An anarchist group of about 10 people attacked the Iranian embassy in Athens, smashing windows and throwing red paint in the courtyard in protest at Tehran's treatment of its Kurdish population. The attack was later claimed by Rouvikonas. The police officer on guard duty at the time of the attack was put under investigation for his handling of the incident, as video footage revealed he did not protect the embassy and was not dressed in his uniform.
On 16 September, 2018, 5 protesters of Bessrochny Protest were detained in Moscow. Another 10 were reported detained at another location in Moscow.
On 12 September, 2018, few protesters of Besrochny Protest in Moscow were detained
On 11 September, 2018, few protesters of Besrochny Protest in Moscow were detained
On 10 September, protesters tried to hold another rally in Moscow against pension reforms, but were prevented by the police
On 9 September 2018, protest against pension reform was held in Moscow, which reportedly ended up in detention of up to 50 people. Additionally, two men were charged with assailing police.

On Sept. 7, 2018: Members of the activist group against drinking alcohol in public places Lev Protiv beat up several people, who they assumed had been drinking. The incident was reported by a woman, who said some of the civilians were disabled and all of them seemed sober. A friend of a disabled person who was among the assaulted group also said that Lev Protiv exercised violence against disabled people.
On the night of 7-8 September, SERB activists attacked two volunteers guarding the Nemtsov's memorial in Moscow.
On Sept. 6, 2018: Anarchist group Rouvikonas invaded the Ministry of Agricultural Development in Athens and scattered fliers with anti-austerity slogans. 10 suspects were detained later.

On September 5th 2018, in Minsk, prominent Belarusian opposition leader Pavel Sevyarynets was arrested and placed in a detention facility. As Mr Sevyarynets told BelaPAN earlier in the day, he was apprehended by police at about 2 p.m., as soon as he arrived at Kurapaty, a Stalin-era mass execution site.

On 5 September, a car drove into a group of protesters in Moscow and gunfire was opened by people from another car. The attacks targeted an event supporting Green Alliance candidate for the position of Moscow Governor. The event was also a protest against construction of a plant and landfill.

On 5 September 2018, in Odessa, unidentified person shot with small firearms at renown activist Andriy Vagapov, the victim sustained injures to his legs and was hospitalized. Vagapov is a lawyer and member of public coordination council of National Police in Odessa Region.

On September 1st 2018, in Minsk, three opposition activists were arrested by police outside a restaurant near Kurapaty, a Stalin-era mass execution site, after protesters were assaulted by the restaurant's security.

assoc_actor_1: Youth of Moldova; Unirea-ODIP; Alliance for the Centenary; BUN: National Unity Bloc; Protesters (Romania); Labour Group (Moldova)
source: Digi24; Unimedia; Mesager; Ziarul de Garda
notes: On September 1st, the Moldovan policeman stopped three buses with supporters of Moldova-Romania Union outside Chisinau. Several unionists were forcefully removed from the buses for searches.
On 31 August, six people were detained in Moscow following an unsanctioned protest in demand of freedom of speech. The rally was organized by Other Russia activists.
On 25 August, participants of the rally in memory of Demonstration of Seven were detained in Moscow.

source: Viasna; Nasha Niva; RFE/RL; BelaPAN; Svaboda.org
notes: On August 24th 2018, in Minsk, some 20 opposition activists were arrested outside the House of Justice in Minsk on 24 August for protesting the conviction of labour union leaders Henadz Fyadynich and Ihar Komlik. The latters, two Belarusian independent trade union leaders involved in organizing street protests in 2017 have been sentenced to four years of "restricted freedom" on the same day.

On 6 August 2018, a TV journalist of the "Extraordinary News" programme [on a popular ICTV channel], Viktoriya Senyk, and her parents' house outside Kyiv was attacked. The police unit did not managed to detain the attackers, who fled by car. One of the attackers was allegedly identified. Preliminarily, he is from a Chechen criminal group and was placed on the wanted list.

On Aug. 3, 2018: Anti-establishment group Rouvikonas staged a paint attack on the General Secretariat for Public Works on Alexandras Avenue in Athens. The act of vandalism was a protest at the government's slow response to the wildfires that struck Attica last month.

On 2 August 2018, in Odessa, a lorry rammed a car of local activists, the leader of the People's Movement of Ukraine party (Narodnyy Rukh Ukrayiny), Hryhoriy Kozma, and his colleague Mykhaylo Kuzakon. Police have opened a criminal case over attempted murder. Kuzakon linked the accident to his social and political activities, suggesting that "representatives of local authorities" were behind the attack.
On 17 July 2018, Vitaliy Shabunin, the head of the Anticorruption Action Centre in Kyiv, was attacked with antiseptic liquid thrown at his face for attempting to confront a politician.
On Jul. 16 2018, two members of the local municipal police forces 'Municipal Guard' pepper sprayed and beat three journalists in Odessa, Ukraine.

On 15th June, four members of the protest group Pussy Riot invaded the pitch during a match of the World Cup. They were dressed in police uniforms and wanted to protest against police abuses this way. All of them were detained and then sentenced to 15 days in administrative detention.

On July 9, two important senior members of the Memorial international center, Oleg Orlov and Svetlana Gannushkina have been detained and later released over violation of a public event rules, respectively for holding a picket in support of the Memorial's Chechen branch leader Oyub Titiyev. They may be fined or punished other way in the future.
On Jul. 8 2018, a grenade exploded in Lviv, Ukraine, killing a man and injuring a woman.

On July 4th 2018, in Homel, 11 teenagers used the Internet to lure at least three gay men into meeting them. The young men reportedly threatened their victims with violence, beat them up, douse them with an antiseptic green dye and filmed the abuse. A group of 11 teenagers resident in Homel and the Homel region have been given suspended prison sentences ranging from one to two years for violence and bullying against gay men.

assoc_actor_1: BSDP-PA: Belarusian Social Democratic Party-People's Assembly; Orthodox Christian Group (Belarus)
source: Viasna; AP; Nasha Niva; Charter-97; TUT.BY; RFE/RL; Svaboda.org
notes: On July 3rd 2018, in Minsk, about 20 to 30 protesters have been arrested including prominent Belarusian opposition figure Mikalay Statkevich and other activists have been detained by police during an unsanctioned rally in Minsk. The detainees included a priest of the Belarusian Autocephalous Orthodox Church, civic activist Nina Bahinskaya, and Belarusian Social Democratic Party (People's Hramada) members Valyantsin Trokski and Syarhey Sparysh and five observers of the Human Rights Center "Viasna" and BHC: Hanna Sakhankova, Andrus Krechka, Tatsiana Mastykina, Yury Miatselski and Alena Bohdan.

On July 3rd, several activists held a protest in Moscow in order to aware foreign visitors of the soccer world cup about issues regarding human rights in Russia. Four of them, including minors, were briefly detained. During the protest, they were wearing bloody shirts as a sign of human rights abusing, especially the case of Oleg Sentsov.

On July 1, 2018: Citizens gathered to demonstrate at Syntagma Square in Athens against the deal between Athens and Skopje over Macedonia's name. Demonstrators threw stones at and clashed with police, who used tear gas to disperse the crowds. Three rioters were detained.

On June 28th 2018, in Minsk, Police detained three gay rights activists (students of the theater laboratory Fortinbras, Volha Ramashka, Nadzeya Krapivina and Dzmitry Yafremau) and a photojournalist during a protest outside the Interior Ministry's headquarters. The photojournalist was identified as BelaPAN's Andrey Shawlyuha. He was reportedly charged with disobedience to police orders and spent the night at a police station.

On 24 June 2018, the former governor or Arkhangelsk and Alexander Donskoy were beaten up by unknown persons in Moscow. According to the victim, the incident is related to their performance in the 'No Necrophilia' theatre play, which refers to people queuing up to visit Lenin's Mausoleum and look at Lenin's dead body.

As reported on Jun. 23 2018, unidentified individuals threw an RGD-5 grenade into a car belonging to the head of the 'Slaves are not allowed to Paradise' NGO, Ivan Sprynskyi in Lviv, Ukraine. No reports of fatalities/injuries (it is assumed the owner was not in the car at the time).

source: Interfax; Human Rights Information Centre; HRW; RFE/RL; Deutsche Welle
notes: On Jun. 23 2018, a group of masked men attacked a Roma camp near Lviv, Ukraine. The attackers killed one person, four more, including a 10-year-old child, were hospitalized with stab wounds. Eight individuals were detained. Some reports mention, the attackers might belong to a far right group who call themselves 'Sober and Angry Youth.' [Since all the previously reported attacks on Roma camps were organized by far right groups, we have included them as an associate.]

source: Hromadske Radio; Liveuamap; Human Rights Information Centre
notes: Between Jun. 18 and Jun. 24 2018, more than 20 LGBT activists and volunteers of the March of Equality were assaulted and beaten in Kyiv, Ukraine.

In June, a person died while being detained at a local police department in Moscow. Four months later, no explanation as to what was the cause of death was provided by the department of internal affairs.
On Jun. 8 2018, three unidentified perpetrators knocked of the feet and beat a journalist Kostyantyn Hrechanyy in Odessa, Ukraine.

source: Ukraine General Newswire; Human Rights Information Centre
notes: On Jun. 5 2018, two men armed with knives attacked a leader of Odessa Automaidan and a member of the Public Control Council of the National Anti-Corruption Buro Vitalii Ustymenko in Odessa, Ukraine. Vitalii received a puncture wound, a stab wound, a head injury and a concussion.
On Jun. 5 2018, an unidentified attacker shot the Chornomorsk city council official Serhiy Chervachov several times with an automatic pistol in Odessa oblast, Ukraine.

Around 31 May 2018, several participants in a protest against the construction of an amusement wheel were detained in Moscow. Several dozen persons interrupted a meeting with the State Duma deputy from the Communist Party of the RF where the matter was being discussed.
On May 24 2018, two men armed with knifes attacked the former leader of the Odessa branch of the Right Sector Serhiy Sternenko. Serhiy Sternenko killed one of the attackers while defending himself.

assoc_actor_1: DIYA: Governmental Initiative of Yarosh; National Corps Party
notes: On 21 May 2018, about 50 people gathered in front of the office building of a private company in Odessa, some of them wearing insignia of groups such as the State Initiative of Yarosh (DIYA), National Corps and the Council for Public Security. Some of the participants were throwing plastic bottles of water and other objects towards the private security guards and shouting slogans critical of the owner of the company. The SMM saw that one of the vehicles of the company parked nearby had broken windows and later it saw some of the rioters smashing the windows of another vehicle belonging to the company.

On May 19th 2018, in Minsk, well-known independent economist Syarhey Chaly was beaten up by unidentified individuals. Five unknown men attacked Chaly and his companions outside a Minsk cafe, breaking his nose and inflicting serious head injuries. Five people suspected of beating Belarusian economist Syarhey Chaly have been detained.

On May 19th, a group of Orthodox Christians held a protest in central Chisinau, condemning the LGBT solidarity march. The police intervened by setting barriers between the two crowds, but also by spraying teargas.

source: Hromadske Radio; Liveuamap; Human Rights Information Centre
notes: On 16 May 2018, around 50 ultra-right activists disrupted a lecture on LGBT rights organized for the second time by Amnesty International. The participants of the event have recognized among the disrupters a representative of Right Sector organization and Svoboda Party.

actor2: Police Forces of Greece (2015-) Units for the Reinstatement of Order
notes: On May 15 2018, Greek leftist groups and Palestinians marched from the Athens Concert Hall and nearby American Embassy in central Athens to the Israeli embassy in the north suburbs of the city to express solidarity to Palestinians following the deaths by Israeli soldiers in the Gaza Strip of Palestinian demonstrators against the opening of the US Embassy in Jerusalem. The rioters burned Israeli flags, climbed on the riot police vans waving Palestinian flags and attacked with stones and other objects the vans and the riot squad.

assoc_actor_1: LF: Left Front; RPR-PARNAS: Republican Party of Russia-People's Freedom Party; GI: Civic Initiative Party; Yabloko: Russian United Democratic Party; PPR: Pirate Party of Russia; Democratic Choice; Open Russia; Black Bloc
notes: On 13 May 2018, 1000-3000 persons participated in a sanctioned protest against the blocking of the Telegram messaging application. The protest involved members of LF, RPR-PARNAS, GI, Yabloko, PPR, DCR, Open Russia, Black Bloc, the Nation and Freedom Committee and the National Resistance Association. 20-30 people were detained by the police forces of Russia for openly protesting for different reasons than the purpose of the rally agreed by the authorities.

source: The Moscow Times; MediaZone; OVD Info
notes: On 9 May, 23 activists of the Left Front were detained as they took part in the sanctioned rally with protests banners against Vladimir Putin and Dmitry Medvedev in Moscow. They were released later on to the exception of one person.

assoc_actor_1: OUN: Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists; C14; Nationalist Group (Ukraine)
notes: On 9 May 2018, in Kyiv, about 10,000 people took part in a Victory Day commemoration event marching to lay flowers near the Monument to the Unknown Soldier. Kiev police detained 14 participants for wearing banned symbols "of the communist totalitarian regime," including the Saint George's ribbon. They face a fine. The SMM observed dozens of counter-demonstrators around the metro station, including from the Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists (OUN), C14 and Monolit. There were minor scuffles.

source: Sputnik News Service; AP; Interfax; RFE/RL
notes: On 9 May 2018, the director of a Russian cultural office in Kiev, Konstantin Vorobyov, was drenched with a bucketful of green antiseptic liquid ("zelenka") mixed with faeces, with a Ukrainian C14 ultranationalist group saying it wanted to send him a message.

On 6 May 2018, in Odessa, a woman was attacked by an unknown young man, accompanied by another man, who called her a 'separatist' and struck her face twice, cutting her upper lip. The woman was subsequently transported to a hospital.

assoc_actor_2: Ecological Platform; Military Forces of Ukraine (2014-)
notes: On 2 May 2018, after a lecture at a bookstore in Lviv, a JTO serviceman and an activist of the Ecological Platform organization, Rodion Bagaev, was beaten up by a group of six men belonging to ultraright groups. The attackers were identified as members of the National Corps Party and Natsionalni Druzhyny. According to other activists of the Ecological Platform, similar attacks by the same men happened before during other leftist events in Lviv.

source: Sputnik News Service; OSCE SMM-Ukraine; Interfax
notes: On 2 May 2018, unidentified 'radicals' beat up a man who was laying flowers during the so-called march of Ukrainian order in central Odessa commemorating deadly fire in Odessa on 2 May 2014.

assoc_actor_1: BCDTU: Belarusian Congress of Democratic Trade Unions; BSDP-A: Belarusian Social Democratic Party-Assembly
notes: On May 1st 2018, in Minsk, some 150 people gathered in a remote park on Tuesday for a May Day rally organized by the Belarusian Congress of Democratic Trade Unions (BCDTU). Shortly afterward, as 4 BSDP-A: Belarusian Social Democratic Party-Assembly activists were leaving the venue, they were arrested and taken to a police station. On May 2, 3 our of 4 activists fined for unsanctioned rally.
On 1 May, 2018 it was reported that law enforcement officials detained a group of SERB nationalist activists who tried to disturb the exhibition at the Sakharov Center in Moscow.

A 1 May march in Odessa finishes after a dozen of young men from a pro-Ukrainian public organisation block a motorway to prevent the participants of a pro-Russian activists attempting to march through the central part of the city in a column.

source: Ukraine General Newswire; OSCE SMM-Ukraine; Novyny
notes: On 1 May 2018 a former head of the Odessa regional branch of the Ukrainian far-right Right Sector party, Serhiy Sternenko, was attacked with a rubber-bullet pistol. Sternenko was shot in the head, but his life is out of danger. Two suspects are detained during police investigation of the attack.
On 30 April 2018, Ukrainian MP Mustafa Nayyem was attacked in the center of Kyiv by unidentified individuals as a result of a road conflict.

assoc_actor_2: PSPU: Progressive Socialist Party of Ukraine
notes: On 26 April 2018, two members of the far-right radical group C14 poured kefir on Progressive Socialist Party leader Nataliya Vitrenko outside a Kiev court. While splashing kefir two masked men shouted "Glory to Ukraine!", "Glory to the nation!" and "There will be no peace for commies on Ukrainian soil".

On 16 April 2018, young people who "were shouting far-right slogans" dismantled tents of activists of the Association for Ukrainian-Moldovan Cooperation who were collecting signatures for the strengthening of Ukrainian-Moldovan relations, as well as the cancellation of "discriminatory" norms of the new law "On education". The tents were dismantled in Odessa, Izmayil and Tatarbunary, and the attackers "called for lynching of the non-Ukrainian population".

On April 14, 4 people were arrested on a rally organized by Yabloko against construction of the stadium Krasnaya Strela in Moscow. It was later revealed that the police simply removed some activists from the scene and that those may have been activists from the other activist group.

On March 26, thousands of people gathered to protest against the corruption news related to the president Vladimir Putin upon the call of Alexey Navalny, the founder of the Progress Party. One of the protests took place in Moscow city in Moscow municipality, Moscow. Police forces intervened and detained some protesters, including Navalny.

assoc_actor_2: ICRC: International Committee of the Red Cross; Police Forces of Ukraine (2014-)
notes: On March 26, 2018 according to Human Rights Information Centre, an unspecified number of rioters tried to prevent the conduct of the discussion of the delegation of the International Committee of the Red Cross "Women on the frontline: how they have changed by the new realities". The rioters raised a buzz and broke the photo exhibition that was posted on the walls. After the police arrived rioters were pushed out of the room.

On March 26, 2018 according to Human Rights Information Centre, few dozen members of the far right groups tried to prevent the conduct of the discussion about the problem of the spread of ultra-right movements in Ukraine, that was held in Kiev. They tried to prevent people from entering the building where the discussion was held, but shortly were thrown out by the police forces.
On March 23, police arrested and beat opposition activist Ales Lahvinets of the Movement For Freedom near his home in the city of Minsk, causing him to be hospitalized.
On Mar. 21, 2018: Anti-auction demonstrators threw eggs at the police outside a notary's office in Athens. Police used shields and tear gas to disperse the demonstration.
On March 21, 2018 Intellinews reported that an Azerbaijani journalist, Fikret Huseynli, was attacked at his residence in Kyiv by unknown persons, which resulted in several injuries.

actor1: Police Forces of Russia (2000-) Federal Security Service
notes: On 15 March 2018, the Federal Security Service conducted search at the house of Ruslan Kostylenkov as part of the New greatness case. Kostylenkov reported being beaten up and tortured during the search of his home to obtain confession. In addition, other members of the New Greatness movement were arrested in Moscow on suspicion of extremism.
On March 14th 2018, several anarchist activists were detained throughout Moscow. One activist was subjected to torture while in police custody and was forced to deliver a confession.
On March 14, 2018, an explosive device had been thrown into Lychakiv cemetery in Lviv.
The chairman of the Yabloko party was detained by police following a speech at the Mothers' March in Moscow.

On March 09, 2018 Ukrainian News Agency reported that unknown persons beat a non-affiliated member of the Ukrainian Parliament Levchenko (Svoboda party) in Kyiv, while he was protesting with activists at what they regard as an illegal construction site. On March 9, police opened a criminal case following the incident.

On March 08, 2018 OSCE SMM-Ukraine saw about 200 people in Lviv, 70 per cent of them were women, marching with signs calling for gender equality, an end to domestic and gender-based violence, and an end to 'the patriarchy.' SMM reports that about 20 young women were protesting against the march with signs written in Ukrainian such as 'Feminism is destruction' and 'Gender quotas are discrimination" and about other forty activists of right-wing groups were walking alongside the march. The Mission saw that at one point scuffles broke out between one of these activists and a participant in the women's march and that the police detain the activist. [size=200]

assoc_actor_1: Sokil; C14; OUN: Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists
notes: On March 06, 2018, about 50 protestors with the insignia of Sokil, Organisation of Ukrainian Nationalists (OUN) and C14 gathered outside the main entrance of the Lviv National Opera preventing approximately 350 ticketholders from entering. They were demonstrating against the performance because one of its singers had previously performed in the Russian Federation and Crimea. Rioters poured red liquid in front of the main entrance of the opera and shoved a representative of the singer.

source: Jurnal; Newsmaker.md; Moldova.org; Ziarul de Garda
notes: As reported on March 5th, a two-person filming crew of JurnalTV was beaten by the guard of the businessman Iurie Luncasu while conducting an investigation in Chisinau.

On February 27, 2018, Ukrainian nationalists have attacked a building of the Russian Consulate General in Odessa, throwing flares at the facility and smearing its fence with red paint. About 50 policemen did not intervene in "the provocation".

On February 26th, three unidentified individuals attacked the head of Moscow's district Kurkinno (North-Western administrative okrug) Ilya Svetikov, when he was stepping out of his car in garages. Svetikov was only slightly injured and claims that the assault was supposed to threaten him.

On February 26, 2018 according to Zerkalo Nedeli, Prosecutor-General Yuriy Lutsenko attacked the activists who set up a tent camp outside his house in Kiev. The picketers say that the prosecutor-general came to them with an axe and accompanied by two body guards and threatened them with retaliation, saying obscenities. Also, he smashed their generator with an axe, cut the cables and tore down the banner calling for the release of Severion Dangadze.

On Feb. 25, 2018: Anarchist group tossed flyers outside former Prime Minister Papademos' home in Palaio Psychico, Athens, and spray-painted slogans on the sidewalk in solidarity with prisoner Giagtzoglou, who had been suspected of sending a bomb which seriously injured Papademos in 2016.

On February 23, 2018 the OSCE SMM-Ukraine observed about 100 people wearing camouflage and balaclavas, however some recognized as members of Automaidan Odessa, Sokil and Odessa Self-Defence groups. People gathered outside the building of the Sanatorium 'Lermontovskyi' in Odessa to 'take back the building that had been seized in the early morning' by the authorities. It was reported that some minor scuffles took place between the participants of the gathering and the police.

On February 23, 2018 according to OSCE SMM-Ukraine about 120 people carrying white flags with yellow flames and 'Faith and Memory' written in Russian gathered at the monument of the Unknown Sailor in Shevchenko Park in Odessa to commemorate the Defender of the Fatherland day. About 300m away, the SMM observed police officers preventing a group of about 20 people from attending the gathering. The police told the SMM that they had prevented the group's participation as those in the group had refused to identify themselves.
On February 23, 2018, an unknown person has sprayed pepper gas in the face of Odessa regional councillor Oleksiy Kobylnikov.
On February 18th, Belarusian journalist Andrus Kozel was beaten by four policemen whilst filming in a polling station in Minsk.

assoc_actor_1: OUN: Organization of Ukrainian Nationalists; White Hammer; SNA: Social-National Assembly
notes: On 18 February, about 100 rioters including members of OUN, White Hammer, Social-National Assembly, Black Committee and Committee for the Liberation of Political Prisoners, attacked the offices of Russia's Alfa Bank and Sberbank as well as the Russian Cultural Centers in the Kiev, chanting slogans against Russia and causing material damage. Members of the Ukrainian National Guard and police deployed nearby did not intervene. No casualties were reported.

On February 17th, law enforcers interrupted a protest of shareholders of a company, who were allegedly cheated by the presidential candidate Pavel Grudinin. They held their protest in Moscow near a building, where the Communist party was currently organising a national forum of investors. 15 protesters were detained, documented and later released.

assoc_actor_1: C14; Right Sector; Traditions and Order; Radical Party
notes: On 17 February, about 30 rioters, among them members of C14, Right Sector, Traditions and Order and Verkhovna Rada member Andriy Lozovyi (Radical Party), attacked the Russian Cultural Center in Kiev, causing material damage and threatening people inside. No casualties were reported.

On February 16, 2018 the SMM observed appr. 200 people demonstrating against the outcome of the pre-trial detention hearing for the mayor of Odessa in front of the City Hall in Odessa. People were affiliated with the groups Right Sector, AutoMaidan and Svoboda. There was a minor scuffle between the police and two men with a Svoboda insignia.

On February 13, 2018, some activists tried to force a journalist Maksym Voitenko out of the courtroom of the Kyivsky District Court of Odessa. On February 14, 2018, the police opened criminal proceedings under Part 1, Article 171 (obstruction of the lawful professional activity of journalists) of the Criminal Code of Ukraine.

assoc_actor_2: Police Forces of Ukraine (2014-) State Border Guard Service
notes: On February 12, 2018 , State Border Guard Service together the Migration Service and National Police informed Mikheil Saakashvili on the decision of his expulsion from Kiev, Ukraine. During this process, unidentified individuals from Mikhail Saakashvili's entourage attacked law enforcement officials. Border guards were forced to defend themselves and employed force support.

actor1: Police Forces of Ukraine (2014-) ARMA: National Agency for Identifying, Tracing and Managing Assets Obtained through Corruption and Other Crimes
notes: On February 8, 2018, a journalist was injured after gas was dispersed in the Vesti office as the National Agency for Identifying, Tracing and Managing Assets Obtained through Corruption and Other Crimes took control of the editorial offices of the Vesti newspaper in Kiev. This was done under criminal proceedings against the former minister for taxes and levies, who is accused of corruption.
On Feb 7, six animal rights activits demonstrated at the Agro-Farm exhibition in Moscow. All were detained and taken to a police station; later in the night were released.

On February 7, 2018, in Kiev, members of the National Corps attacked two men who were planning to distribute "antifascist" leaflets. The victims claimed to be members of the Communist Party from western Ukraine.
On 7 February 2018 a former head of the Odessa regional branch of the Ukrainian far-right Right Sector party, Serhiy Sternenko, was attacked outside his home.

On January 31st, a lawyer and human-rights activist Valentin Karelin was attacked by (probably) three unindentified masked individuals in Moscow - Krylatsk. Karelin is well-known as a lawyer assisting local activists and politicians.

On January 29, 2018, an unidentified young man wearing a balaclava entered the premises of the Bookshop "Ye" in Lviv. He threw a smoke bomb in the room with appr. 50 people listening to a lecture "Terrible History: Holocaust. Memory. Pain. Lessons" and ran away. [Similar attacks by far right groups happened throughout the year during lectures/activities related to human rights e.g. LGBT/Roma/Women's rights, environmental issues etc.]

assoc_actor_1: Vigilante Group (Ukraine); C14; Traditions and Order
notes: On 25 January 2018, the far-right organizations C14, Tradition and Order and Falcon have raided the office of the Union of Orthodox Journalists, where members of the groups say they found anti-Ukrainian materials.

On 22th January, six activists of the unregistered party The Other Russia (National Bolsheviks) held a protest in front of the Russian Central Election Commission in Moscow. They lit flares and souted demands to revise privatisation in 1990s. All were detained immediately.

On Jan. 21, 2018: Greek demonstrators who staged a rally against Macedonia's name chased Greece's former deputy minister of Education, Kostas Zouraris threatening to lynch him. Zouraris resigned the previous week over his insults about football fans, which caused public discontent. No injuries were reported.
On Jan. 20, 2018: Unknown individuals attacked the Embassy of Ukraine in Athens by throwing Molotov cocktails at the building. Allegedly, three cars near the embassy were also set on fire.

On January 19th, around 500 individuals took part at a traditional march in Moscow in memory of Stanislav Markelov and Anastasia Baburova, a lawyer and a journalist of Novaya Gazeta, both killed in 2009. According to more sources, 1-4 individuals were detained, because their faces were covered.

On 19th January, Ilya S., the 'Left-Bloc' activist, was beaten by three unidentified masked individuals in Moscow near the Domodedovsaya station. They referred to the just-finished rally in memory of the lawyer Stanislav Markelov and Anastasia Baburova and started beating him for his participation at the rally. Later, other pedestrians scared them out.

On January 18, 2018 according to Zaxid, the police arrested six journalists of the Lviv newspaper Ekspres while they protested outside the building in Lviv, where President Petro Poroshenko held a meeting with Canada's Governor General Julie Payette.

source: Greek Reporter; The National Herald; AP; Ekathimerini; EuroNews; Xinhua; Reuters
notes: On Jan. 15, 2018: Around 20,000 rioters demonstrated in Athens against the government's newly approved austerity measures. Rioters threw petrol bombs and stones at the police, who used pepper spray. No one was injured or arrested.

source: AP; The National Herald; Greek Reporter; Ekathimerini
notes: On Jan 10, 2018: Anti-austerity demonstrators in Athens reached the entrance of the prime minister's official residence. One police officer was hospitalized with a light injury and the demonstrators eventually left peacefully.
On Jan. 9, 2018: Dozens of people taking part in a Communist Party-affiliated demonstration broke into the Labour Ministry using crowbars. No injuries or arrests were reported.

On July 5th, a dozen of employees of Teatre.doc were arrested in Moscow during a peaceful picket protest in support of the arrested Ukrainian Oleg Sentsov. Reportedly, nine of them were detained due to alleged drug use and drunkness, another actress was hit, but not detained. A protester, who was filming the detention, was forced to erase the video. All were detained later in the night.
On January 01, 2018, a car knocked down a "well-known rights defender" activist Oleksandr Orlov in Odessa. Activists think that Orlov could have been knocked down deliberately.
